connector.description: Receive notifications about new issues from Jira through OAuth authentication.

camel.kamelet.jira-oauth-source.jiraUrl.name: camel.kamelet.jira-oauth-source.jiraUrl
camel.kamelet.jira-oauth-source.jiraUrl.description: The URL of your instance of Jira Example: http://my_jira.com:8081

camel.kamelet.jira-oauth-source.accessTo.name: camel.kamelet.jira-oauth-source.accessToken
camel.kamelet.jira-oauth-source.accessTo.description: The access token generated by the Jira server.

camel.kamelet.jira-oauth-source.verifica.name: camel.kamelet.jira-oauth-source.verificationCode
camel.kamelet.jira-oauth-source.verifica.description: The verification code from Jira generated in the first step of the authorization proccess.

camel.kamelet.jira-oauth-source.consumer.name: camel.kamelet.jira-oauth-source.consumerKey
camel.kamelet.jira-oauth-source.consumer.description: The consumer key from Jira settings.

camel.kamelet.jira-oauth-source.privateK.name: camel.kamelet.jira-oauth-source.privateKey
camel.kamelet.jira-oauth-source.privateK.description: The private key generated by the client to encrypt the conversation to the server.

camel.kamelet.jira-oauth-source.jql.name: camel.kamelet.jira-oauth-source.jql
camel.kamelet.jira-oauth-source.jql.description: A query to filter issues Example: project=MyProject
